name: Barbell Bench Press
description: A classic compound movement focusing on chest development and upper body pushing strength.
excerciseInformation: The barbell bench press is one of the most effective exercises for building upper body mass and strength.
executionSteps: Step 1. Lie flat on a bench with feet planted on the floor.
Step 2. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width and lower it to your chest.
Step 3. Press the bar back up until your arms are fully extended.

name: Barbell Back Squat
description: The king of lower body exercises, targeting legs, hips, and core.
excerciseInformation: A fundamental compound exercise for building leg power and overall strength.
executionSteps: Step 1. Position the barbell across your upper back.
Step 2. Brace your core and descend until thighs are parallel to the floor.
Step 3. Drive through your heels to stand back up.

name: Deadlift
description: A total-body powerhouse movement focusing on posterior chain strength.
excerciseInformation: The deadlift builds overall strength, improving posture and athletic performance.
executionSteps: Step 1. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell overhand.
Step 2. Keep your back straight as you lift the bar by driving through your legs.
Step 3. Lower the bar under control back to the floor.

name: Pull-Up
description: A fundamental upper body exercise targeting the lats and biceps using bodyweight.
excerciseInformation: The pull-up is a measure of pure upper body control and strength.
executionSteps: Step 1. Grip the bar slightly wider than shoulder width with palms facing away.
Step 2. Pull your chin above the bar by contracting your lats.
Step 3. Lower yourself under control until arms are fully extended.

name: Overhead Shoulder Press
description: A pressing movement targeting shoulder and triceps strength.
excerciseInformation: The overhead press develops shoulder stability and raw pressing power.
executionSteps: Step 1. Grip the bar at shoulder level with palms facing forward.
Step 2. Press the bar overhead until arms are fully extended.
Step 3. Lower it back to the starting position in control.

name: Barbell Bicep Curl
description: A staple isolation movement for building arm size and strength.
excerciseInformation: Focuses on isolating the biceps for muscle growth and definition.
executionSteps: Step 1. Hold the barbell with an underhand grip at shoulder width.
Step 2. Curl the bar toward your chest while keeping elbows stationary.
Step 3. Lower the bar slowly back down.

name: Dumbbell Lateral Raise
description: A shoulder isolation exercise to shape and widen your delts.
excerciseInformation: Lateral raises target the side shoulders for a broader appearance.
executionSteps: Step 1. Hold dumbbells by your sides with a slight bend in your elbows.
Step 2. Raise the weights out to shoulder height.
Step 3. Lower them slowly back to your sides.

name: Barbell Row
description: A compound pulling movement for back thickness and posture.
excerciseInformation: The barbell row strengthens your back and improves pulling performance.
executionSteps: Step 1. Grip the barbell with an overhand grip and bend at the hips.
Step 2. Pull the barbell toward your lower rib cage.
Step 3. Lower it back down with control.

name: Leg Press
description: A lower-body powerhouse exercise focusing on quads and glutes.
excerciseInformation: The leg press builds leg mass and strength safely using a machine.
executionSteps: Step 1. Sit on the leg press machine and place feet shoulder-width on the platform.
Step 2. Lower the sled until knees are at 90 degrees.
Step 3. Push through your heels to return to starting position.

name: Plank
description: An isometric core exercise for stability and endurance.
excerciseInformation: The plank improves core stability and posture while reducing injury risk.
executionSteps: Step 1. Get into a push-up position resting on forearms.
Step 2. Keep your body straight from head to heels.
Step 3. Hold this position for the desired time.
